examples: Hot cognition, on the other hand, involves emotion.

words.defineEn: the result of a mental processing or understanding

examples: Clinical depression is different.

examples: Of course, other thinkers at that time were also talking about developmental crises.

examples: Phobia sufferers often find themselves virtual prisoners in their own home.

words.defineEn: a great fear of an object or situation that is irrational

examples: The scientist understood that every bean has its black, and that even the most promising hypothesis may have flaws that need to be addressed and overcome.

examples: Half of them, after treatment, got placebo.

examples: But not all people with schizotypal personality disorder develop schizophrenia.

Other research has connected IL-6 specifically to schizophrenia.

examples: And that psychological anguish takes a toll physically.

words.defineEn: connected with the scientific study of the human mind and its functions

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.

As I bit into the mombin, its fibrous texture and tropical taste brought back childhood memories.
words.defineEn: the ability of mind to keep and remember past events, people, experiences, etc.

examples: A 1990 study in The Journal of Applied Psychology examined this idea using 407 undergraduate business students.

examples: Under stress, the body produces adrenalin.

examples: The harsh criticism tore him out of his delusions of grandeur.
You have delusions.
Fregoli delusion has the opposite problem.

words.defineEn: (psychology) a mental condition in which a person has a false belief system that is contradicted by evidence
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) một tình trạng tâm thần trong đó một người có hệ thống niềm tin sai lầm trái ngược với bằng chứng

examples: Voter suppression is white supremacy.

The two sides of the same coin, it’s suppression of workers’ wages, OK?

words.defineEn: (psychology) the conscious act of holding a thought or feeling back
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) hành động có ý thức kìm lại một suy nghĩ hoặc cảm xúc

examples: Harassment or bullying is unacceptable behavior in the workplace.
Her behavior toward her colleagues was unprofessional.
The parent modeled good behavior by always wearing a seatbelt in the car, even for short trips.
The CEO's focus on customer satisfaction was reflected in the employees' behavior, as like master, like man.
Here are 4 behaviors a narcissist displays that reveals their true colors.
words.defineEn: (psychology) the way a person or an animal acts in different situations or responds to stimuli
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) cách một người hoặc một con vật hành động trong các tình huống khác nhau hoặc phản ứng với các kích thích

examples: Perceptual constancy is what allows us to continue to recognize an object regardless of its distance, viewing angle, motion, or illumination, even as it might appear to change color, size, shape, and brightness depending on the conditions.
And in addition to organizing things by form, depth, and motion, our perception of the world also requires consistency, or as psychologists call it, constancy.

This is one of the consequences forced upon us by the constancy of the speed of light: in a universe (like ours) where changes of velocity don't change the speed of light, then changes of moving perspective can never make other velocities change from a relative speed less than the speed of light, to a relative speed equal to or greater than light.
words.defineEn: (psychology) the tendency to keep the same perception of an object despite changes in the stimuli
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) xu hướng giữ nguyên nhận thức về một đối tượng bất chấp những thay đổi trong các kích thích

examples: You don't have to be a comedian or a super extrovert.
Introversion later came to mean shyness, while an extrovert was someone outgoing.
For example, introverts are usually better at interpreting people's feelings, while extroverts are often better at expressing them.

The Swiss psychiatrist Carl Jung, who popularized the terms introvert and extrovert, defined an introvert as someone who sticks to their principles regardless of situation, and an extrovert as someone who molds their self according to circumstance.
Today, an introvert is someone who finds alone time restorative, an extrovert draws energy from social interaction, and an ambivert falls somewhere between these two extremes.
words.defineEn: (psychology) a person that is preoccupied with external things and prefers social situations
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) một người bận tâm đến những thứ bên ngoài và thích các tình huống xã hội

examples: Sarah's father always told her that honest men marry quickly, wise men not at all, but she didn't believe in such generalizations and chose to make her own decisions about marriage.

There in wine is found the great generalization: all life is fermentation.
words.defineEn: (psychology) the tendency to show an identical response to similar but distinct stimuli
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) xu hướng thể hiện một phản ứng giống hệt nhau đối với các kích thích tương tự nhưng khác biệt

examples: Don't make a habit of it.

examples: Did your friend ask for permission to use the image?

words.defineEn: a mental perception resembling an external phenomenon
words.defineVi: một nhận thức tinh thần giống như một hiện tượng bên ngoài

Wells, a self-described introvert, is their celebrity guru.

words.defineEn: (psychology) a person who is preoccupied with their own thoughts and feelings rather than the external world

examples: The celebrity's public persona was sweet and kind, but her staff knew that she could be demanding and difficult to work with - she had a honey tongue, but a heart of gall, as the saying goes.

That was another persona.
Kahlo created her own myth, her own persona.
words.defineEn: (psychology) a person's social representation or the impression other's have of a certain individual which is concealing the true self
words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) đại diện xã hội của một người hoặc ấn tượng của người khác về một cá nhân nào đó đang che giấu con người thật

examples: He knew the process backwards.

words.defineVi: (tâm lý học) bất kỳ chức năng nhận thức nào liên quan đến việc hiểu và học

examples: To possess power is the ultimate ego trip for most people.

She sufficiently strokes his ego by saying how much she likes his book to make him overlook any potential concerns.
He was on another one of his ego trips, directing and taking the main part in a movie.

examples: And your superego is made up of the cultural values and norms that you internalize and use to guide your decisions.
The i d contains those basic instincts, which just want pleasure all the time, while the superego has your morals and self-control.
So if the i d is the devil on your shoulder, the superego is the angel on the other shoulder, and the ego is the mediator who intervenes when the angel and devil start fighting.
He thought the mind was made of three parts: the i d, the ego, and the superego.
According to Freud, the i d and superego were mostly unconscious, so you didn’t know they were influencing your choices or thoughts.
words.defineEn: (psychology) the part of the mind that is only partly conscious, representing social norms learned from the parents

examples: Sarah went through a lot of emotional turmoil after her breakup with Mark.
